meanings.definition: The protoplasm of a cell nucleus.
meanings.sent1: The nucleoplasm contains important materials for the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the nucleoplasm to understand cell functions better.
meanings.sent3: The nucleoplasm decided to throw a party in the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swirled in her mind like nucleoplasm in a nucleus.
meanings.sent5: The glowing nucleoplasm illuminated the tiny cell nucleus.

meanings.definition: The substance of a cell nucleus, especially that not forming part of a nucleolus.
meanings.sent1: The nucleoplasm surrounds the nucleolus in the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent2: The nucleoplasm plays a crucial role in maintaining cell structure.
meanings.sent3: The nucleoplasm and nucleolus had a friendly chat in the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent4: His ideas floated around his mind like nucleoplasm in a nucleus.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant nucleoplasm contrasted with the dark cell nucleus.
